page.title: 13Road Transport Museum.
page.content: Since the Middle Ages Coventry has been a manufacturing city. First woollen cloth then ribbons and watches then James Starley's bicycles, this led to the start of the motor industry.The Museum of British Road Transport shows the part Coventry played in the history of road transport in Britain. It has over 13O cars and commercial vehicles, 2OO cycles, 7O motorcycles,a considerable range of related artefacts, literature and photographs in its collection.The collection was described by the New York Times as "The finest technical collection in Western Europe".The displays are arranged in chronological order so that a visitor is carried through the whole story of British transport.
